content.description:
The penguin population on an island is modeled by a differentiable function P of time t, where P(t) is the number of penguins and t is measured in years for 0 ≤ t ≤ 40. There are 100,000 penguins on the island at time t = 0. The birth rate for the penguins on the island is modeled by

B(t) = 1000e0.06t penguins per year

and the death rate for the penguins on the island is modeled by

D(t)=250e0.1t penguins per year.
content.question: To the nearest whole number, what is the average rate of change of the penguin population on the island for 0 ≤ t ≤ 40?

frqParts.text: To the nearest whole number, what is the average rate of change of the penguin population on the island for 0 ≤ t ≤ 40?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
